raw_comment:
I notice that the richer families with a legacy boost are more easily admitted to high prestige colleges whereas poorer families have to work harder to be admitted due to their financial situation.

I wonder how this graph would look in more present time and if the situation has worsened or gotten better.  I also wonder why high prestige colleges look for applicants with a legacy; instead of the applicants with the best scores and criterion.

This relates to my community because people tend to judge others based on their education and what college they attended.  I am also starting to look at colleges to attend and I find it crazy that some elite colleges are this biased towards high income and legacies.

"Attending College May Not be as Easy as it Seems"
